paper_abstract: In this paper we propose an algorithm of factoring any integer N which has k different prime factors with the same bit-length, when about (1/k+2 + epsilon/k-1) log(2) N high-order bits of each prime factor are given. For a fixed epsilon, the running time of our algorithm is heuristic polynomial in (log(2) N). Our factoring algorithm is based on a lattice-based algorithm of solving any k-variate polynomial equation over Z, which might be an independent interest.
paper_title: Factorization of square-free integers with high bits known
